text.div:
NHSNInfectionConditionCode

Code System: SNOMED CT 2.16.840.1.113883.6.96 or cdcNHSN 2.16.840.1.113883.6.277

A full listing of codes can be found in the hai_voc.xls file provided with this package.

This value set includes codes from the following code systems:

  • Include these codes as defined in urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.6.96
    CodeDisplay
    2707005Necrotizing enterocolitis
    9826008Conjunctivitis
    12463005Infectious gastroenteritis
    19824006Skin
    25374005Gastroenteritis
    36971009Sinusitis
    47597000Mediastinitis
    56819008Endocarditis
    60168000Osteomyelitis
    78623009Endometritis
    128241005Hepatitis
    239095007Omphalitis
    300927001Episiotomy
    302935008Disc space
    312157006Infectious mediastinitis
  • Include these codes as defined in urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.6.277
    CodeDisplay
    1601-4Breast abscess or mastitis
    1602-2Myocarditis or pericarditis
    1603-0Clinical sepsis
    1604-8Deep incisional primary SSI
    1605-5Deep incisional secondary SSI
    1606-3Vertebral disc space infection
    1607-1Ear or mastoid infection (otitis externa, otitis media, otitis interna, mastoiditis)
    1608-9Eye infection, other than conjunctivitis
    1609-7Gastrointestinal tract infection (esophagus, stomach, small and large bowel, and rectum) excluding gastroenteritis and appendicitis
    1610-5Intraabdominal infection, not specified elsewhere including gallbladder, bile ducts, liver (excluding viral hepatitis), spleen, pancreas, peritoneum, subphrenic or subdiaphragmatic space, or other intraabdominal tissue or area not specified elsewhere
    1611-3Intracranial infection (brain abscess, subdural or epidural infection, encephalitis)
    1612-1Joint or bursa infection
    1613-9Laboratory-confirmed bloodstream infection
    1614-7Other infections of the lower respiratory tract, other than pneumonia
    1615-4Meningitis or ventriculitis
    1616-2Oral cavity infection (mouth, tongue, or gums)
    1617-0Other infections of the male or female reproductive tract (epididymis, testes, prostate, vagina, ovaries, uterus, or other deep pelvic tissues, excluding endometritis or vaginal cuff infections)
    1618-8Other infections of the urinary tract (kidney, ureter, bladder, urethra, or tissue surrounding the retroperitoneal or perinephric space)
    1619-6Spinal abscess without meningitis
    1620-4Superficial incisional primary SSI
    1621-2Superficial incisional secondary SSI
    1622-0Upper respiratory tract infection, pharyngitis, laryngitis, epiglottitis
    1623-8Arterial or venous infection
    1624-6Vaginal cuff infection
    1625-3Symptomatic UTI (SUTI)
    1626-1PNU1
    1631-1PNU2
    1632-9PNU3
    1671-7Bronchitis, tracheitis
    1672-5Burn
    1673-3Decubitus ulcer
    1674-1Disseminated infection
    1675-8Infant pustulosis
    1676-6Newborn circumcision
    1677-4Soft tissue, muscle, lymph node, or salivary gland
    2402-6Asymptomatic Bacteremic UTI (ABUTI)
    1970-3Periprosthetic Joint Infection
    1640-2Organ/space
    2343-4VAC - Ventilator-Associated Condition
    2344-2IVAC - Infection-related Ventilator-Associated Complication
    2345-0PVAP - Possible Ventilator-Associated Pneumonia

name: NHSNInfectionConditionCode
description:
Code System: SNOMED CT 2.16.840.1.113883.6.96 or cdcNHSN 2.16.840.1.113883.6.277

A full listing of codes can be found in the hai_voc.xls file provided with this package.

concept.display: Ear or mastoid infection (otitis externa, otitis media, otitis interna, mastoiditis)
Gastrointestinal tract infection (esophagus, stomach, small and large bowel, and rectum) excluding gastroenteritis and appendicitis

Intraabdominal infection, not specified elsewhere including gallbladder, bile ducts, liver (excluding viral hepatitis), spleen, pancreas, peritoneum, subphrenic or subdiaphragmatic space, or other intraabdominal tissue or area not specified elsewhere
Intracranial infection (brain abscess, subdural or epidural infection, encephalitis)
Other infections of the lower respiratory tract, other than pneumonia
Oral cavity infection (mouth, tongue, or gums)
Other infections of the male or female reproductive tract (epididymis, testes, prostate, vagina, ovaries, uterus, or other deep pelvic tissues, excluding endometritis or vaginal cuff infections)
Other infections of the urinary tract (kidney, ureter, bladder, urethra, or tissue surrounding the retroperitoneal or perinephric space)
Upper respiratory tract infection, pharyngitis, laryngitis, epiglottitis
Soft tissue, muscle, lymph node, or salivary gland
